title: 'The embarrassing silence of Arab countries on the Gaza conflict is cause for concern'
summary: The Hamas attack of October 7 and Israel's indiscriminate retaliation have put the Palestinian question back at the top of the agenda, when it had been overshadowed by the normalization of relationships between Israel and several Arab countries, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: 'She was already dead inside': Forced suicide and the hidden victims of domestic violence
summary: In 2022, 759 women in France took their own lives or attempted to because of harassment by a partner or former partner – an offense that is now recognized in the country, but remains difficult to prove.

title: 'Jacques Delors continued to play an important role in Franco-German dialogue after he retired from politics'
summary: Jacqueline Hénard, former Paris correspondent for the weekly Die Zeit, has written in an article for Le Monde about the former European Commission president's relations with West Germany and then reunified Germany.

title: Argentina: Javier Milei advances his free-market agenda with a comprehensive reform bill
summary: The document, containing 664 articles, builds upon a 'mega-decree' unveiled on December 20. The latter is due to come into force on Friday, but its constitutionality is being questioned by various experts.

title: Iceland: Near the Sundhnjukagigar volcano, a town on edge
summary: Almost ten days after the volcanic eruption, life has not yet returned to normal in the small town of Grindavik. Nevertheless, Icelanders, who have always lived on a highly unstable seismic fault line, remain resilient.

title: Writer of open letter defending Depardieu is Zemmour supporter with far-right connections
summary: Yannis Ezziadi, a little-known actor, is a friend of Sarah Knafo, Eric Zemmour's adviser and partner. He has previously written about 'ethnic French people' being 'culturally threatened by an atmospheric Islam.'

title: US approves 'emergency' weapons sale to Israel
summary: The Biden administration on Friday used an emergency provision to bypass Congress and approve a $148.5 million sale of high-explosive artillery munitions to Israel.

title: South Africa accuses Israel of genocide in Gaza at top UN court
summary: The Israeli government rejected 'with disgust' the genocide accusations, calling it a 'blood libel.'

title: Same-sex blessings open rift between Vatican and African churches
summary: Representatives of the Catholic Church in Africa are hostile to the reform, with homosexuality prohibited in 32 countries on the continent.

title: Argentina formally rejects invitation to join BRICS
summary: In letters sent to leaders of the BRICS bloc of powerful non-Western countries, Argentinian President Javier Milei declared his formal rejection of the membership offer, in line with his campaign promise that 'we are not going to ally with communists.'

title: More than 120 Russian missiles and drones hit Ukraine
summary: The strikes, which came after an attack on a Russian ship in Crimea, have killed at least 30 civilians and injured at least 144.

title: India investigates people smuggling after return of plane halted in France
summary: Indian police said passengers of the Dubai-Nicaragua flight that was grounded in France had paid smugglers to help them reach the southern border of the United States.

title: Emmanuel Macron: 'Our strategy must be to speed up the ecological transition as well as the fight against poverty'
summary: In an op-ed in Le Monde, the French president proposes a new global climate pact and calls for a reform of global financial governance to better involve emerging countries.

title: 'France's Stonewall': A trial that became symbolic in the history of gay struggles
summary: 'The underground years' (4/5). Arrested in a Paris bar in 1977, homosexuals refused for the first time to show contrition and used their trial as a platform against 'repression.'

title: French government says 95,000 police and military will be deployed for New Year's Eve
summary: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin cited a heightened 'terrorist threat' requiring tight security.

title: 'US and EU sanctions on Russia are a major driver of global fragmentation'
summary: The Polish economist Beata Javorcik fears that the geopolitical confrontation between, on the one hand, the United States and the European Union, and on the other, China and Russia, will hamper both international trade and the vital need for cooperation on climate change.

title: Le Monde's favorite albums of 2023
summary: We looked back at our music editors' favorite records, including from Blur, Killer Mike, Gabriels, Archie Shepp, Albin de la Simone and Berlioz.

title: Angus Deaton: 'Health threats will remain central to the story of progress and its reversals'
summary: The winner of the 2015 Nobel Prize in Economics questions in an op-ed whether the health setbacks of the past decade are temporary, or only the beginning of worse to come.

title: On the Ukrainian front, kamikaze drone pilot Yana's mission: 'Destroy'
summary: At the age of 22, this determined young woman joined the army after fleeing the town of Kherson, which had been occupied by Russian forces for several months. She is now fighting in the Donbas.

title: Senegal's authorities prohibit nomination meeting planned for opposition leader Sonko
summary: Sonko had submitted his candidacy with the constitutional council to contest the February election – despite the state's refusal to provide him with the necessary documents.

title: 'Saltburn,' on Prime Video: Class struggle and unconscious impulses in an English manor house
summary: The second film from Emerald Fennell, director of 'Promising Young Woman,' plays ferociously with the traditional figures of British comedy.

title: The French left's ambivalence toward Jacques Delors and his legacy
summary: The former European Commission president embodied a culture of governance and was seen as a 'reference.' But some Socialists also saw him as a 'dream-breaker' who promoted budgetary rigor.

title: School uniforms in France: The story of a failed experiment
summary: With the education minister exploring standardized outfits for students, a 2018 experiment by a small town French mayor highlights the challenges of such an initiative.

title: Eurostar cancels trains due to flooded UK tunnels
summary: At least 14 trains on the service that runs from London to Paris, Brussels and Amsterdam were canceled, stranding thousands of passengers just ahead of New Year's Eve.

title: Depardieu: President Macron's political error
summary: The presumption of innocence the French leader invoked in discussing the sexual assault allegations against the actor is a principle worth defending. But to proclaim pride in a man who regularly displays his contempt for France and his admiration for Vladimir Putin is ludicrous.

title: 'Punishing homosexuals was re-vol-ting': Robert Badinter's 1982 plea for the gay cause
summary: 'The underground years (5/5).' On August 4, 1982, at President François Mitterrand's instigation, France's so-called 'offense of homosexuality' was repealed. Addressing Parliament, Justice Minister Robert Badinter said: 'It's high time we realized just how much France owes to homosexuals.'

title: Stuck in Jerusalem, the parish priest of Gaza is trying everything to protect his besieged community
summary: Since the October 7 Hamas attack, Gabriel Romanelli has been unable to return to the Palestinian enclave. Until he is allowed back in, he is doing his best from a distance to help the 600 people who have taken refuge in his parish.

title: 10 killed by shelling on Russia's Belgorod following Moscow's aerial assault against Ukraine
summary: Russian officials accused Kyiv of carrying out the attack, which took place the day after an 18-hour aerial Russian barrage across Ukraine killed at least 39 civilians.

title: Thousands accuse Serbia's ruling populists of election fraud at Belgrade rally
summary: The demonstration capped nearly two weeks of street protests against reported widespread irregularities during the December 17 parliamentary and local ballot that were also noted by international election observers.

title: '2023 will be remembered as the year of two wars'
summary: Columnist Alain Frachon offers some thoughts on this year of war in Ukraine and between Israel and Hamas, as seen by experts and essayists in search of an elusive 'international system.'

title: Edith Piaf's miraculous devotion to Thérèse de Lisieux
summary: Edith Piaf's lifelong devotion to Thérèse de Lisieux was rooted in a childhood experience. As we commemorate the 60th anniversary of her death in 2023, we zoom in on the spiritual journey of 'La Môme.'

title: Joe and Jill Biden and their beautiful toys. Does anyone care?
summary: On December 22, the American presidential couple visited patients at Washington Children's Hospital. And they were in for a treat.

title: Science highlights of 2023: Cosmic images, a genetic hybrid ape, a necropolis in Paris...
summary: Discover the highlights of a year of scientific and medical news, as well as the inspiring people who left their mark on 2023.

title: Prestigious parties, promoters and unlimited champagne: 'In the VIP area, the girls are cattle'
summary: In the nightclubs of Paris's 'golden triangle,' a playground for the city's rich kids, the success of the VIP lounge is based on the objectification of the female body as a business model.
